62139_J05FWZR6_1:
(D) O.K./OK.

O.Q. is an abbreviation of "O.K.," which is a slang term used to indicate approval, agreement, or confirmation. In twentieth-century American English, O.Q. was sometimes used as a more casual alternative to "O.K." or "all right," and it is likely that this is the meaning intended in the context of the story.
